  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING IN THE LOADSIDE AREA. CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE DURING HANDLING. PACKAGE SECURED IN HAZMAT DRUM AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: CAPS OF BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED IN PLASTIC BAG AND HAZMAT DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was call over to unload due to a leaking hazmat . DescribePack: The caps were loose causing hazmat to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Qa clean up the spill place hazmat inside a red tote to be taking over to the hazmat area for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021321
item.description:
Report X-2024021321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/6/2024 at approximately 2200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 750823 at the ramp facility in Atlanta reporting a dangerous goods spill. The package consisted of 4 plastic bottles inside of a fiberboard box, one of which had a loose cap, resulting in spillage. The spillage was contained, and the shipment was placed in a salvage drum. The shipment awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.
